es.usal.bicoverlapper.data
Class MicroarrayData

java.lang.Object
  es.usal.bicoverlapper.data.MicroarrayData

public class MicroarrayData
extends java.lang.Object

Class with data of Microarray expression levels, using Prefuse Tables We will generically refer to genes and conditions, although genes could be instead nucleotide sequences and conditions can be experiments, patients, etc.

MicroarrayData will contain:

For each gene/condition:

"name" - name of the gene/condition (String)-,

"id" - unique identifier for the gene/condition (int)- and

"rowRank"/"colRank" - order in which it is drawn (int).

For each expression level:

"gene" - name of the gene for this expression level (String)-,

"condition" - name of the condition for this expression level (String)-,

"rowId" - id of the gene for this expression level (int)-,

"colId" - id of the condition for this expression level (int)-,

"rowRank" - order in which the gene is drawn (int)-,

"colRank" - order in which the condition is drawn (int)- and

"level" - expression level (double)

Author:
Rodrigo Santamaría

MicroarrayData

public MicroarrayData(java.lang.String path,
                      boolean invert,
                      int rowHeader,
                      int colHeader)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Constructor from a file

Parameters:
path - Path to the file with microarray information
invert - true if genes are columns (genes as rows are considered as the usual option)
rowHeader - Number of initial rows with row information (usually one)
colHeader - Number of initial columns with column information (usually one)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
